title: 1927 FA Cup Final
summary: The 1927 FA Cup Final was an association football match between Cardiff City and Arsenal on 23 April 1927 at the Empire Stadium (the original Wembley Stadium). The final was the showpiece match of English football's primary cup competition, the Football Association Challenge Cup (FA Cup), organised by the Football Association. Cardiff, one of the few Welsh teams taking part, won the match 1â€“0. Their victory remains the only occasion the trophy, which was previously known as the "English Cup", has been won by a team based outside England.
